reviewText: This works as advertised, which is, admittedly, pretty darn cool. What is NOT cool is that I'm unable to use my aux output for my MP3 player if I want to use this. This is a major drawback for me. Plus, it's frustrating to have yet another wire dangling from my dash. I've already got my phone charger and my GPS running wires from there. I'd rather use a Bluetooth headset and be able to listen to my music, and still be prepared to take a call if need be. It needs some improvement before I'd heartily recommend it.

This is the perfect size to sit on my desk at work to add just the right amount of moisture to the air in the cold, dry winter months. I use a cool mist humidifier at home, why not at work? Runs quietly on USB power and looks adorable. It's about the size of a grapefruit so it's not intrusive. Sample provided for reviewing.

Great headset, straight forward setup, nice streaming feature (you can stream all iPhone sounds to the headset). I even use it to watch videos in my ipad!
Headset battery life shows on iPhone screen. Excellent battery life. Fits very well in the ear without the loop that goes behind the ear, although this option is available in the box. Very light weight. Sound is very clear.

Problems:
1)Button is beautiful bu cumbersome to use, because pressing it requires good force inwards which pushes the headset forcibly into your ear, this could be painful. I learned to press it first then put the headset into my ear.
2)Voice commands "answer" or "ignore" do not work unless I shout 2-3 times!!
3)Single button sound level control. I prefer two buttons (volume up & down).

I've used this item for about a week now. It recharges my iPhone 7 plus maybe 3-4 times. I've had many different brands and models. For the money this is hard to beat. It looks and feels "ok" but works well. Keep in mind you didn't spend $20. It's a very fair deal

not recommended

I got a fantastic deal on this thing, at&t was selling them here for $19.99 so I snatched it up.  Figured even if it was a dud I couldn't go too wrong at that price.  I don't use the phone or sim.  I just use it to connect to wifi for FB, library, weather, photos, etc. I had wanted to use it as a radio for when I'm out walking the dog, but so far the only app I've found insists I agree to let at&t charge me mega amounts for the data use, so I passed on that. But that's ok, my REAL (non at&t) phone has a radio with no charge for using it.
The missing star is because I find taking photos with it a hassle. I think my photo button is broken, so I have to find the app, which wants to show me pics when I want to take one, and wants to take one when I want to look at pics taken. I have to wrestle it into submission. hard to see what I'm doing when out in the sun...  but, somehow I have managed to get a few good shots.
Also, and I don't know if this is just a component of all smart phones or just this one, but it's unreliable in it's functions on the web. On FB sometimes I'll have to stab LIKE ten times to get it to take, sometimes it won't re-orient it's self when I turn it for a wider view, and sometimes it won't expand something I'm trying to look at, or will suddenly be too sensitive, taking orders I didn't give, driving me nuts and sending me back to my computer.  But all in all, for 19.99 it's nice to have access to the web when not sitting in front of my computer.  I'm glad I didn't pay any more than that though.
UPDATE:  1 1/2 yrs later.  at least 25 times a day I'd like to throw this thing at a wall.  Like I said above, I got it to use as a portable FB, mostly but other things too.  The Windows-created App for FB (you have to download it from the windows store) is a bloody nightmare, Seriously, it crashes, (which means it drops you out of FB and back to your start page maybe every 3 - 5 minutes.  I kid you not.  Thank god I've still got a desktop computer or I would have killed this thing by now.  Evidently Windows went on to make OTHER versions for their newer, pricier phones, and have said f.u. to the lumina 520 users.  It never upgrades. i've uninstalled it and reinstalled in hopes of getting a better version.  No such luck.  it's just a peice of you know what.  But all my other apps are fine as wine. I can games for hours, NO PROBLEMO!  It's just the windows FB app.  Thanks Mr Gates.  ..not.  Oh, and one other thing, since we can only get apps from the windows store, wouldn't it be NICE if windows would make a bloomin APP for THAT? Instead of making us navigate their PC website which our phone HATE.  I finally started using App of the day, but you can't just go shopping with that, you get what they deliver.  if you want to look for an app...  such nonsense...
summary: Not bad, if you get it cheap

Highly recommended. 12/18/13 Review update: I have to downgrade product to 4-stars because durability may be a problem. Fixed it with electrical tape- looks bad but it works.

reviewText: excelente

Great

A good alternative to carrying a battery, separate charging cable, and USB charger.  However, separate similar capacity batteries sell for about 25% of this so you must weigh convenience against price.  No doubt there is a lot of clever engineering in this all-in-one unit.  It is somewhat large for its capacity.  I charge several Apple and non-Apple devices on the road and this battery garners three or more charges depending on the device.  For example, it can charge my iPhone about three times before needing recharging itself.

As to form factor, it fits easily into my laptop or carry-on bag.  Overall this is a good all-in-one device if that is what you need.  I believe the price should come down for it to be competitive or it will remain a niche product.  In weighing price versus performance I dock it one star for price.  There is simply so much completion in this market that you should consider your needs before purchase.

First, watch the video on Amazon to get an idea of what this headset is like because to write it all out would be redundant, nor would I be able to describe it well enough.

Pros:
- The sound quality is fantastic - no complaints from the other side.
- Super-light. Various buds to maximize comfort, including an earloop.
- The portable charger acts like a case.
- So many features on this tiny thing, including some automatic ones that you can choose to use or not.
- You can see the charge levels!

Cons:
- Does not come with a wall charger. Use your favorite micro-USB charger if you're in the house - I'm sure you have more than plenty.
- (Very minor) I have to take off the earloop to charge it in the case.
- Expensive.

Still, this thing works so well while keeping your comfortable that I love it enough to give it five stars.
summary: Light, comfortable headset with many features.

reviewText:
This case works great on my LG Nexus 4. I especially love the corners that are made of a soft rubber that really feel like they can take a drop. The two-piece design works great, and I have no problems with the hard part falling off or anything. It is actually qutie entertaining just to take it on and off, and once you know how, it is not hard and actually fun.

It has awesome protection all around the phone and it does not pull up my XO skin screen protector hardly at all. My Poetic bumper for my Nexus 4 pulls up the screen protector badly. The buttons feel great. After using a BoxWave case, this feels like you are actually using the real buttons instead of rubber covering above them. Ports microphones, cameras, and speakers all are cut for great.

I would highly recommend this case for anyone regretting that there is no OtterBox for the Nexus 4. I was very discouraged that there was no OtterBox and then I got this. I have seen and compared this case to a friend's OtterBox Commuter (for his HTC One S) and this has much better protection and costs half as much as an OtterBox.
summary: Awesome case. For once, I feel like I can actually use my Nexus 4.

reviewText: I have 2 extra now!  First one went on super easy and super clean... if you know what you are doing this is so easy to install.

Fits the phone nicely while also having enough good space to double as a real wallet with sufficient room for cards, cash, etc.

My only criticism is that the plastic holder is rather thin, brittle and fragile, and breaks at the corners very easily if you drop the case.  Fortunately it does protect the phone from breaking, but the phone edges can get dinged.

Another issue is that the plastic outer case becomes too soft after awhile, so that the stand/easel feature is no longer effective....the phone slips down too easily and pretty much lays flat.  I have had other folios that held up better.
summary: Nice fit for Phone and Wallet purposes, but does not hold up too well with usage

reviewText:
This is a nice case for the iPhone 6 however the cons outweigh the the pros for me.

PROS:
Good look and feel
No Newton rings rainbow effect
Satisfactory touch response on the built-in screen protector

CONS:
The fit of the rear case to the front case is loose especially around the volume buttons.  It feels as if the case will eventually fall off if it stretches.
The built-in screen protector does not sit flush to the phone's screen.  While this helps alleviate the rainbow effect, it allows large dust particles to get under the screen.  This is the deal breaker for me.
The built-in screen protects accumulates heavy fingerprints that requires constant cleaning.  The cleaning introduces dust particles.  So frustrating.

Sadly,  I'm returning this case for something better.
summary: A Nice Looking Case But a Huge Dust Magnet and Poor Fit.  Requires Constant Cleaning.  Deal Breaker for Me.

reviewText:
Only two stars for now because the one I had (just returned it and re-ordered a replacement) I assume must be defective.  I would charge it for 12 hours or more and when I unplugged it the unit would say "5 hours of talk time".  I would then use it and the battery would die with much less than 30 minutes of talk time.  I have to assume it is defective as other reviewers say the talk time is much better than that.

I have had both the Roadster 2 as well as the Jabra Freeway.  The Roadster 2 is mediocre at best and I would not recommend that unit at all.  It's a single speaker and caller on other end has a very  hard time hearing you if there is any background noise at all.  Might be great in a new Rolls Royce but the average car at highways speed makes it a poor device.

Jabra freeway is very good, almost as good as the Roadster pro.  I give that one less star than this Roadster Pro.  Just as good for the user but the Roadster pro deserves one star above the Jabra Freeway for better noise cancelling.  Your caller hears you much clearer.

However, the Jabra gets one more star than the Roadster pro for overall features because it has a built in FM modulator allowing you to use it to transfer audio, be it a call or music, from your phone to your car audio speakers.  That being said, the Jabra FM modulator really only works if you are either in the middle of no-where or standing still because the FM channels all around you will overpower the Jabra as you drive along if you are anywhere metropolitan.

If the replacement Roadster pro that I get back has adequate battery life then I will review this "review" and give it 4 stars.  It loses one of the 5 for not having the FM modulator.
summary: Only two stars for now - I think mine was defective - returned and re-order and will review again.

I had the greatest smartphone experience ever with this phone. After 2.5 years of wonderful use, the battery button finally has gotten stuck and the phone will brick once it shuts off for whatever reason.

The best features of this phone are its durability (withstood many drops), reliability (still works fast to this day) and it's features. The KEYBOARD IS YES. It supports smart swipe functions and the on screen keyboard can be interchanged with google swype and bitmojis. I couldn't have asked for a better experience.

The cons of this phone are more of an I wish I had my cake and could eat it too moment. None of these cons, NONE, were a deal breaker in fully experiencing the bliss of this wonderful phone. The phone was so perfect in that I was terrified of doing anything that could break it. Since it's not water resistant, I spent more time protecting it than enjoying it. There is so much android bloatware that heavy use of this phone will not last a day (the tradeoff to having superior graphics and high performance with only 3g of ram. Many phones had 4g when this came out.) The front facing cam will make no one look good (it's atrocious) and the main camera was left to be unsaid. Waste of 18mp when it doesn't fully support snapchat easily. And yes, this phone does get hot very easily on its right side. Open the slider and don't use videos galore while fast charging. Use battery saver as much as possible because it shuts down all the background apps that drain the battery. The battery thing does suck when it's heated, but not a reason to run from this beautiful phone. All about taking the good with the challenges.

I used this phone heavily for social communication and my school work. Disabled blackberry apps and as much bloatware as I could. Definitely rely on greenify's force close funciton (nonroot). The blackberry just came out with a rugged phone called "motion", but it's missing the qwerty (only the NEC terrain and the Runbo X3 achieved this, but they only access wifi but don't have an app store to be called a true smartphone). Once a water resistant (doesn't even have to be IP 68 or 67) QEWRTY comes out by blackberry, I'LL BE BACK :). Enjoy this fantastic smart phone.
summary: Don't be fooled. This phone is from the age of the gods!

This holds an iphone or ipod well.  However if you have a tablet you probably will only want to use is in the portrait mode.  I have an 8" tablet and it will not stretch open far enough.  The description says it will hold a tablet up to 25" wide.  The only way this will hold a tablet that wide is not like the picture shows.  Instead you just set it flat on the table with the thumbs and the ridge pointing up from the table.  You would then set your tablet so that the ridge is on the front edge of the tablet with the back of the tablet resting on the thumbs.  This will give you 1 and only 1 viewing angle.

For an ipod or iphone you change the viewing angle by sliding the "hands" higher or lower on the device.  I have an iphone 5s, the hands completely cover one half of the speakers no matter how low or high i put them.

Thought the product would be much better.  A great idea.  I wish the "hands" were smaller and didn't take up so much of the edge of the phone.
summary: The only way this will hold a tablet that wide is not like the picture shows

This screen protector is the best product you can find on the market today. I have used so many different materials of clear film screen protectors and many tempered glass screen protectors from different brands in the last 5 years. I have tried almost all kinds of screen protector on the market and they were absolutely terrible. The ArmorSuit is so far one of the best on the market especially for the "Edge" phone. It provides Edge to edge coverage (most of the brands don't cover the curve part of the edge phone). Easy to install. The most accurate cutting for all sensors/camera holes and home button.

When you do the installation, try to do it at the end of the night before you go to bed, because it is better to take some time to dry, you don't need to use your phone while you're sleeping. What I did was that I got it all lined up and pushed the water out. If you notice dust, hair or anything underneath the film, you can lift the film back up, clean it off and wet it again to apply on your device. After letting it dry overnight, I can't tell that there's a screen protector on. It is so perfectly fit my phone that you can't even see it.

Here is how I installed this:
1. Clean the screen thoroughly with the provided micro cloth.

2. Spray both of your hands, fingers and screen with the solution provided.

3. Peel off the screen and spray on the adhesive side of the screen (unlike many other screen protector, you only need to peel off one side of the
screen, the adhesive side, there is no second peel off step for the back side).

4. Align the screen protector on your device, you can slide until you get a desired result.

5. Use the very nice soft squeegee they provide to smudge out the fluid and air bubbles.

6. Use a hair dryer on low setting to heat it up a little after I had it position right to make it tack up faster and rubbed around all the edges to make
sure it stuck good (If you do notice dust, hair or anything you can lift it back up, clean it off an wet it again to apply it).

7. Leave it on the table and go to sleep, all imperfection such as hard to kill tiny bubbles and vapor will disappear (Yes! they will disappear by
themselves).

8. Now you have a nicely protected S7 Edge without even noticing that the screen is there. Enjoy!!!

Hope this helps!

I've had similar-looking magnetic mounts on my phone in the past, and while they've worked exceedingly well, most unfortunately don't fit my 2010 Prius very well because of its strange windshield shape -- it's angled too high and none of the stick-on mounts do a good job as far as reachability. Since I never use the CD player on my car, I found that this particular mount worked out pretty well in my unique use case. As far as mounting goes, it does its job fairly well, and passed the test by surviving a four-hour drive through desert roads last week.

The mount works via a strong rare-earth magnet attached to the mount's face (I have no idea how this harms the phone long-term, however) and the mount itself comes with two sets of plates to use, one of which was a flat rectangular one that I slide below my iPhone 6's case. The mount is sturdy and holds the phone surprisingly well.

One caveat though: if you have a navigation system, the wing nut used to secure the rubber part that goes in the CD tray blocks your view quite a bit. I wish the manufacturer had a better way of securing this in place. I don't mind it because I hardly use my nav unit, but it could be a deal breaker for some.
summary: Works perfect for my needs, a few caveats

reviewText:
I use this to charge my phone overnight.  I typically go to bed later than my wife, and thus don't want to be fumbling around in the dark to find and insert a regular charging cable.  I have this on my nightstand; I lay the phone on it and in the morning my phone is fully charged, with my phone at hand the whole time.

A couple of notes/observations.  The unit comes with a USB cable, but not a wall plug so you're going to need the latter.  I had a half-dozen laying around from old phones and computer accessories, so it wasn't an issue.  If you don't have a USB wall plug, you'll need to buy one.  The specs say it will work with any wall plug; the one I'm using is from and old wireless router.

Setup requires only that you remove the case back and lay a small card-like thing (provided) over your phone battery.  The card is thin enough that it causes no problems when you replace the case back.  That's all there is to it.

Oh, and it works even with an auxiliary protective case on the phone.  I have a Belkin case on my Note 3, and it doesn't impede the charging function at all.

This is a nice accessory that works as advertised.

reviewText: Excellent charger and case.  Have used for a month so far and had a great experience.  High quality build and feel. Did not buy from Amazon and paid about $20 less.  Still a bit pricey but I have had no problem with the connection between the case and the phone.  The case does what is advertised in that shuts off when your battery gets to 100%.  Case does not get overly warm when it charges.  Best feature is the ability to take the battery component off and just have a slim cover on the case.  I wish it had a little bit more front protection, but the front lip of it does appear to go slightly over the top edge of the glass to provide some protection.  Does add some additional weight to the phone but overall it actually makes the phone easier to hold in my opinion.  Using this case and its 3200 ma battery you will not run out of battery power, no matter how long you were on the phone during the day.  I usually leave the phone in the case just because I don't like to worry about running out of power during the day.  But the ability to be flexible -- to either have it in or out of the battery case -- means you can travel light when needed, or have access to everything on the bottom of the phone that way, and for some applications and uses, that's really important.  Even though it's a bit pricey (and that plus the front screen protection issue is the only reason I am knocking off a star), I am very happy with it and do recommend it.

This power pack seems to have just died even though, now, the little lights are showing a full charge.

I like the idea of Tile. I've found Find My iPhone to be a useful feature when I lose my phone or my iPad, and the idea of being able to affix such a find function to anything is appealing. And the Tile works well in my first tests of it. I asked my son to hide it in the house a few times and every time I was able to find it. So it does what it says. It's also really easy to set up -- download the app, make a free account, sync the Tile with your account, and you're done.

The downsides are small but notable. For one, the chime the Tile makes is rather quiet and easily muffled by, say, a couch cushion. Second, the Tile is obviously designed to be a key fob, and it looks great on keys. For things without a "ring," though, it's got to be stuck on, and it's not terribly elegant as a sicker -- in fact, it's kind of big and clunky. For example, I considered sticking it on the TV remote, since the kids are ALWAYS losing it. But there's nowhere on the remote that's big enough, flat enough, and free enough of buttons to stick it. The Tile isn't great for sticking.
summary: Works Great for a Key Fob Finder

reviewText:
I owned the previous incarnation of this headset (Street2) and loved it to death.  I forgave it when the battery capacity dwindled to only good enough for one bike ride.  But then suddenly one day it lost its stereo sound and I knew the day had come to replace it.  So bear with me if I compare this one to that one a little.

The good:

--Obviously, the battery life is very good, 8 hours plus (but this was true of the first one when it was new.  I expect this one will also slowly shrink down over time).
--The Bluetooth connection is so much easier.  Once paired the first time, subsequent powering on automatically connects to my phone.  With the old model, I had to go through settings screens to confirm the pairing.
--There's a nice new feature where if you hit the volume up button without music playing, the voice announces your battery level (stated as "high" and presumably "low" (I haven't tried this when it was below "high")).
--I like the button design better, much much easier to feel through your shirt.  And, contrary to some complaints that the buttons are too sensitive, I think the power button isn't sensitive enough.  It takes me one or two tries to turn it on or off.  The FF/REW button is just right.  Kind of weird having the volume buttons on the side though, wish they could go where the FM button is (more on that later).
--Much prefer the headset jack on the top rather than the side, just easier to manage the cord that way
--The sound is fantastic.
--Just like its predecessor, very lightweight, you forget it's even there.

Now, the bad:

--First and foremost, the earbuds that come with it are simply awful, and stupidly without them it loses its lanyard function (but at least when you remove the earbuds, there are pieces on the back with tiny holes that you can thread a very thin keyring through to use a lanyard of your own).
--The biggest reason I took off one star:  The FM button.  Really?  Why not just include a Sony Walkman attachment?  Does anyone listen to FM radio anymore?  In the car maybe, but I wear this for exercising and radio ads have a terrible beat, and tend to be incessant.  I wish this could be re-purposed to something more useful, like volume or maybe just a call answer button.
--The battery life is great, but on the old one when you got the first low battery notification, you still had a good hour left.  On this, you get three or four warnings over about fifteen minutes and then you're done.

In summary, overall a vast improvement over the older model.  Now get rid of that useless FM button!
summary: Three steps forward, two steps back

I noticed that a lot of reviews reflect the seller/service received when ordering this product. I can't speak to that, I purchased this model of phone directly from the AT&T store. My review reflects the actual product that I purchased.

I purchased my Desire Eye through AT&T and so far could not be happier! I felt that this was a BIG improvement from the M7, and even though it's in the same model range as the M8 I think that it is vastly superior. They finally got rid of the ultra-pixel camera (what the heck was that about) and now this beauty takes amazing quality photos and is so reasonably priced compared to the M8 and now especially the M9. I ended up picking this over the M9 simply based on price. I felt the M9 wasn't a significant enough improvement over this model to warrant the crazy price difference. Lollipop for Android was also recently released for this model.

My only gripe with this phone is the vibrate. It's so quiet I hardly ever hear it or feel it. I'm an anti-chime person, so I miss calls and texts all the time. Additionally, I'm a big fan of OtterBox but because this model isn't as coveted as the M-line, there aren't many color options, leaving me with an off-brand case that has held up reasonably but doesn't feel the same.

EDIT 9/13/2016: I've had this phone for a year and a half and it still runs like a dream. I have the option to upgrade after 2 years, but I might save myself some money and keep this model unless a vastly superior phone comes out. So far nothing has caught my eye.

This Jinxixinke case can truly be used as a full wallet replacement, if you don't mind keeping it all together.  This has enough pockets and slots to replace much of your wallet.  Usually, there's a slot or two for an emergency card, but this can replace your whole wallet.  As such it is quite thick once you're loaded up, but in total its less volume than a regular phone case plus a typical wallet.  There are 3 explicit card pockets which can be doubled up, though I do think it would rip if you always kept them doubled up. Behind that there's a fold for more cards or money, and yet another full length pocket behind that.  I keep a few cases depending on occasions, so I do often carry a separate wallet, but for certain events, travel, etc. this is ideal to really consolidate what you're carrying.  Phone fits well, no issues getting it in, out, or plugging in, etc.  The texture is nice, has kind of an embossed abstract floral texture.  With all of the heft, it will likely cushion quite a fall as well. It's not really designed for an impact, but the leather or leather like material, and layers would probably protect better than some impact cases in a drop situation.  Also is handy that you can talk on it while the case is closed. I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

This review is for the Aukey 50W / 10A 6 Port USB Desktop Charger, I have bought a total of 5 of these, 2 that I use personally and 3 others that were given as gifts...and everyone loves them.  They work great and have charged every device and combination of devices I have thrown at them.  The fact that any port can be used for any device is great, unlike other chargers that make you figure out which port to use for which device...and refuse to work or overheat if you guess wrong.

My only wish, and this is personal, is that the next version will include one small LED to indicate that the charger itself is actually plugged in and receiving AC power.  For those of you that don't like LEDs...that's what a small piece of electricians tape is for.  :-)

5 Stars to Aukey for this charger, and the idea within the USB community to promote USB as a worldwide power standard has been a terrific innovation!
summary: Great product, flawless charging.  Every port works for any device.

reviewText:
I like the shell, with a few caveats, but the belt clip broke the first time I got in the car.

The shell fits, snugly and it's not too bulky and I like the kickstand.  It is a bit tight when putting it on and I suggest putting in the power button side first as you can bend the longer bar over the volume button more easily.  Hopefully that will make sense if you have it in hand.  The kickstand is jolly but not very stable vertically and a little hard to close.  Follow the enclosed instructions and it's not bad.

The belt clip is more problematic.  the phone only slides in one way and I'm not sure how that was going to work for me as it slides in from the end rather than the side.  "Fortunately", I won't have to find out as the first time I got in the car the belt clip broke off on the seat back.  This is not a problem unique to this case as I've the issue with other hard plastic cases.

2015-01 Update: Some additional info after longer use.

Quite a while back one of the pins that held the kickstand in place broke off so that was no longer available.. The bars over the power and volume buttons made it difficult to get to the buttons so eventually I cut those bars off. I went through a long period of thinking I had a lot of bad USB cables before I figured out that the case comes out too far and makes it difficult to get a good connection with the charging cable.  I also ended up with a chip in one corner of the screen where the phone was dropped WHILE in the case, so not much drop protection here.

Overall, the only thing I really liked was the feel of the case in hand.
summary: I like the feel of the shell but it's not a very good case

I'm a bit particular about phone cases, I've bought a lot of cases for several different phones over the years. This case is the BEST ALL-AROUND CASE I'VE EVER OWENED. It has, IMHO, the best blend of drop protection and slim form factor. It did not increase the size of the phone too much, and to my surprise, it protects better than any other case in it's class. The next best cases I've had would be the Spigen slim armor or the Tech 21 case. All three cases were good, but the magpul was easiest to remove.
PROS: Lower profile than other cases that provide similar/equal protection. I've dropped this from the roof of my SUV and the phone was fine! I'm a bit clumsy when it comes to dropping my phone, and I've put this case to some rigorous testing and it has passes with excellent form. Whatever material Magpul is using is perfect for this type of application. Probably partly lucky nothing ever broke, but that also speaks really well of the case. The case itself has held up better appearance-wise than any other, it doesn't really scratch. I thought the field case form was just for looks, but now realize it helps significantly with grip. I can put this phone on my dash and it does not slide while making a turn. (Magpul sells a phone without the field case grip too)
CONS: One problem I have with this case is that the hole for the 3.5mm headphone jack did not accommodate most accessory cables for use on speaker or car stereo systems. (All cases I've had that provide adequate shock protection have this issue though, so easy removability was a somewhat mitigating factor).
summary: Would I buy again?: Yes, best phone case I've ever owned.

reviewText:
I was so happy to find that it was possible to buy a replacement port cover for my S5. I've had to replace it twice now, I seem to be good at breaking it. This port cover is identical to the one that was originally installed on my phone. It is very easy to replace. It seems to provide the same seal to the USB port area, retaining the water resistant properties of the awesome Galaxy S5.
TO INSTALL: Take the battery back cover off your S5. There are two screws above the USB port at the bottom, the one on the right removes a small panel. Take out that screw and panel, slide the rubber part of the port cover into the space and reinstall that small panel and screw. That's it!
If you're having a hard time with the screw, use better tools. Soft metal (cheap) screwdrivers are the ones that strip your screws!!! This is why I DO NOT recommend buying the port cover that comes with a little cheap tool. I use my own precision screwdriver.
Worked well on my grandma's phone

I purchased this dual port charger to leave in the kitchen for the purpose of charging various Android phones in the household.  Everyone in the house has their own charger, but the kitchen is a magnet for phones.  A dual port charger seemed to be a good size and configuration, since it plugs directly into the wall outlet without additional bulky cords that are typically found on chargers with 4 or more ports.  It's small enough that it does not cover both wall outlets, leaving enough room for a plug or other small device to be plugged in a the same time.  The blue LED light in each USB port was enough to illuminate it, but not obnoxiously bright like some. No overheating occurred.

While the charger is rated up to 2.4A, none of my devices drew anything close to that.  Devices used include:  LG G2, Samsung S4, Samsung S3, Sony Xperia Z3, HTC 626S and Asus ZenFone 2.  All charged okay, but the LG G2 would only pull .45A for some reason.  Several different USB cables were tried, as well as another G2.  The LG G2 should easily pull +1A on a low battery, and does on other chargers.  It's almost like charger was reading the device had a nearly charged battery and was holding at a lower charge rate.

The iSmart Technology is supported to detect the correct maximum charge rate for each device and I'm wondering if perhaps there is some type of incompatibility occurring.  The charger certainly does work on the LG G2, but just at a lower charge rate.

While this is not a vendor review, it makes sense to mention that RAVPower was speedy to reply to my email inquiry about the low charge rate and a replacement was sent out, but it demonstrated the same issue.
summary: Good charger, but it does not like my LG G2

The unit onsists of two pieces, a spring-loaded tablet holder and a suction cup base. With it, you can securely attach a 7 to 10.5 inch tablet to any clean, flat glass surface - like a windshield.

Starting with a clean surface, it was easy to attach the suction cup by pressing it into place and pushing down the lever to secure it. After it was attached, I tried vigorously to pull it off and slide it around with absolutely no success - it was securely moored to the glass.

Attached to the base is a two-piece arm assembly, the bottom part of which moves up and down, while the upper part is connected with a ball and socket joint so it moves and swivels in all directions. Both arms can be tightened in the desired position by turning the attached knobs clockwise.

Next I inserted my tablet diagonally between the two corner brackets of the holder. This arrangement not only prevents the device from slipping, but also avoids blocking either the control buttons or the camera lens opening on both the 7 and 10.5 inch tablets that I used for testing. The spring tension coupled with the rubbery corner-hugging blocks in the mount safely cradles the tablet. Not loose but not too tight.

The entire mounting bracket is easy to reposition or reattach elsewhere. Since the unit uses springs to hold the tablet, it is simple to insert and remove while leaving the base in place. The suction cup base is no problem to detach by first lifting the lock lever, than pulling the tab on the suction cup to break the seal with the glass. The instructions on the package sleeve indicate that the suction cup can be cleaned with warm water and air-dried to restore it. I attached and removed it several times with no noticeable degradation in holding power.

Off-label use, the device is also great for mounting a tablet on the underside of a glass table. I was able to position it at an angle that was clearly viewable and controllable through the table glass.
Other options include mounting it on a bathroom mirror for use when shaving or getting ready for the day, on a glass patio tabletop so it is positioned for optimal viewing and safe from an accidental drop, or even mounted to a window for a variety of uses or to free-up desk space.

This mounting bracket is built solidly and performed flawlessly. Sample provided without obligation by AVANTEK.
summary: AVANTEK Universal Tablet Windshield/Glass Mount Holder

reviewText:
I'm usually a skin kind of a guy, especially with phablets like the N6 and this N6P (if you've never had a skin, you need to try one. See slickwraps.com or dbrand.com). A case will usually make an already huge phone even bigger. This thin fit case caught my eye for exactly that reason, and it has lived up to (almost) every expectation I had for it.

It is super thin, so it adds very little bulk to the phone, but it does add a ton of grip. The feel of this case is similar to the back of a Nexus 5. It's a soft matte finish, but it's super grippy. I can hold it in an open hand almost sideways and it won't fall off. The case also comes up just a hair in front of the glass, so if you set it face down your screen won't get scratched.

The only thing I'm not in love with is the button cutouts. They're a little far back, so you almost have to push the button from behind, if that makes sense. Nothing I can't get used to, but not my favorite. Also, being as thin as it is, this case will offer very little protection if dropped. Because I normally use skins anyway, that's not much of an issue for me. I got this case to protect the phone from scratches, and to give it more grip so I'm far less likely to drop it in the first place. It does both of those things beautifully.

5 stars, all the way.
summary: This case is (almost) everything I hoped it would be

This is my favorite case so far. I call it a "minimal" case. It is good for getting a good grip on the slippery phone. There is not much protection from dropping.

I had bad luck with the screen protector -- just kept getting dust underneath, and it looked bad, so now I use it without the screen protector. Maybe I will buy some other protectors and try my luck again.

I got a free Apple "bumper" case, but none of my non-Apple headphone plugs or multipin adapters will go through the case holes (such as the iGo car power adapter), as they are slightly bigger than the openings. On this case the holes are big enough, and the case is thin enough, that all my non-Apple plugs fit so far.

They could have cut an opening on the back for the Apple logo, for appearance sake, as Elago did on its series of cases for the iPhone 3G.

Be careful putting it on and taking it off. The buttons and silence switch can catch on the case openings, and I don't think you want to apply much sideways force to them. Just bending the sides slightly when putting it on or taking it off takes care of this. I find this a little tricky and I don't think this is a case you want to be putting on and taking off a lot.

After several weeks I now see bit of the rubbery/textured-paint coating rubbing off on the edges where I put the phone face down on a surface, showing the black plastic underneath. It is not easy to see and functionally I do not think it is significant.

When using the phone for turn-by-turn navigation in a car, it warms up quite a bit. I am a little concerned about the case -- any case -- insulating the phone and reducing air cooling. But, this case is thin and that concern will be less on this case than most others, I expect. Regarding this, the Apple bumper is nice as it is open on the back.

This sensor is meant to turn your screen off when making a call, not when using the keypad.

reviewText:
She says
My husband has been testing many car mounts for our phone to find what will work best for us. I'm not a guru in this area, so I can only state what I see, feel, like or dislike. In saying that, I can be opposite in my thinking or views than his on many items I'm not really sure of. Well, I really like this. The suction is strong, not limited because of its moveable arm and no dash will block the camera if we want to record a road trip. This is a sturdy cell phone holder and I don't mind it if placed on the windshield, it doesn't block my view where he placed it and this is my favorite that has come into the house...or should I say vehicle. His view may be different than mine, but I really do like this one far better than the vent holders or magnetic ones.

He says
As you see this is my wifes favorite from the many smartphone holders I have been testing in the search for the 1 mount that works for us all. So far I had settled on a simple mount design, a chrome ball and magnet design. I myself like it but my wife does not as she never gets it on the magnet straight and in turn sends the phone across the car on her first turn. I figured this holder with a flexible arm would be the winner and in turn saved it to the end almost to review. First off the suction cup does work well and has a pump tab to lock it to the windshield. But I never thought of it until I mounted it, being a flexible arm it will bounce as we drive down the road. Double vision will drive me batty after a short time. And being mounted in the middle of the window low it is nice, but still creates a blind spot for me. Being around cars as a past career and driving since 14 (yes I said 14) I don't like anything to block my view point. Mounting this unit on the side to be next to the driver's window was better than the center and easier for me to reach and read, but still created a blind spot for me. Besides being flexible, this unit is neat being it has a clamp to hold the phone, a very strong clamp, that I like to ensure a good grip. So in turn as a vehicle mount this unit does not work for me, but I do see this unit being optimized in our RV instead. As this will be perfect to mount the phone next to the table while we are eating or working. And to be mounted back in the bedroom as well next to the bed, even in the bathroom on the mirror as my wife just chimed in. So for us this mount works in other means than it is advertised for, but in the end we give it a 4 stars because it does work, is flexible, compact and grips the phone well.

To give our quirky and honest opinion of this product, we received a discount. We give nothing but our unbiased opinion, being we expect the same in return. No greenbacks were traded for this review nor does Amazon or the seller influence our decisions. Did we help you?
summary: Wide Variety of Mounting Locations w/ Clamp Cradle!

reviewText:
I agreed to try this device with the best of intentions.  I'd heard a lot about it, and I was intrigued enough to want to check it out.  Like many, I somehow thought it was more like a GPS device that could communicate from afar.  When I learned it was not, I was ever more intrigued about how, exactly, this thing works.

So, the basic premise of this Tile is that most of the time you lose things that are close to you--within the range of your Bluetooth signal on your phone.  If you are outside that range, which Tile claims is about a 100-foot radius, then the best that Tile can do is tell you where it was when it lost contact with you.  That MIGHT be helpful, if it doesn't move from that location, but if somebody else picks up your device and moves it when you are out of range, then you are toast, unless a miracle happens (see next paragraph).

Miracles do occasionally happen, and Tile seems to think that enough people around the planet will adopt this doodad that we will all be finding one another's lost stuff within 100 feet of us and getting it back to the rightful owner.  This seems like a profound stretch to me.  If it is valuable enough for you to put a Tile on it, then it is just as likely, perhaps more likely, to never be returned to you if somebody finds it.  In order for a benevolent citizen to come to your rescue and find your device, they would need to own Tile, have their Bluetooth turned on, and get within 100 feet of your lost item before the evildoer gets your item.  Even if this happened, you or a benevolent citizen would still need to get the lost item from the found location before another evildoer came along.  I like to believe in the good of mankind, but this requires more than just goodness.  It requires goodness with a Tile app on phone, with Bluetooth turned on, within 100 feet of your lost item, with a quick action to retrieve the lost item before it is picked up and moved by somebody else.  I'll buy my lottery tickets before I bet on this alignment of the lost item moons.

Then there are the very practical drawbacks of this item.  It is 25 bucks, it lasts only a year (at which point it is garbage, with no replaceable battery), and it can be synchronized with only 1 phone.  When my wife and I both installed the app and tried to find the same item, we soon learned that the only way this was going to work was to have the Tile associated with just one of our phones.  If you read the Q&A on Amazon, a couple of other folks also wanted to do what my wife and I wanted to do, because it is logical, but it doesn't work.  #Fail

Perhaps I will one day be like Steve Ballmer when the iPhone launched--dismissing it as nothing compared to Windows phones--and I will have to admit that I didn't understand the potential of Tile.  Until then, I am lost, and Tile cannot help me.
summary: I am lost, and Tile cannot help me.

This PS4 Controller Charger Dock is awesome! It's really lightweight, and fits easily wherever you need it. I keep mine on top of my PS4. It comes with a micro USB cable that you plug into the PS4 like any other controller charger cable. When you plug it in, the circle in the middle will glow a light blue to show you that it is on. Then, you just flip down the red tab and slide the controller into place. There is a small micro USB tip that you slide it into, and it will charge it just as quickly as your normal charger. The controller stays securely in place by sitting on the red tab. This is really easy to use and keeps you from having a mess of cables when you try to charger all of your controllers at once. Not only that, but it looks cool too. I've already had a few of my friends ask me where to get one. Overall, I really recommend this product.

Works fantastic to add the hard case protection for your device, as well as being a nice looking case! Comes with a handle strap and with a separate lobster clip, for easy portability! Made of quality materials, for an inexpensive price! I purchased this specifically to transport/protect our brand new Mophie Powerstation XL (12,000 mAh) - Black battery pack and small cables, for when we travel outside the home. It will work great! It is a little snug with the depth of the case when closed with cables inside... so I have taken pictures to show the cables both in the extra compartment in the lid, as well as placing the charging cable with the device in the bottom of the case... both methods work, but putting the larger charging cable with the device allows the case to close a little better. I thought about getting something different, but it's honestly not something worth attempting because this is soooo close to the perfect size, and it will work just fine. I went through a lot of internet surfing to try to find just the right case for the dimensions of the battery pack... which is not a very easy task with the dims of the Mophie Powerstation XL! This case might even work even better for the smaller battery packs that aren't as thick/deep in size. Because my husband will use this as well, I needed a black case... but there is a pink nylon one available that would work as well (which I almost ordered first until I came across this one at the last minute) with PRO Nylon PINK Tough Compact Camera Shell Case fits Canon PowerShot Samsung Smart WB850F WB800F WB350 WB250F WB150F ST200F. After 2 days of searching, I was just about ready to buy the pink one with no other options available in my search... and somehow I came across this one at the last minute! There is also a Navitech case Navitech Black Hard Eva Nylon Protective Tough Carry Case for Tomtom One XL, Tomtom go *20, Tomtom go *30, Tomtom go *40 live, Tomtom go *50 Live that is actually more ideal based on the depth of the case, that would accommodate a little more room for the cables, especially if you plan on having multiple cables in the case. I decided to stick with this particular case because I was trying to stay with something as portable/low profile as possible without adding a ton of bulk to my slim style laptop bag, and that I would keep the charging cable with the device on the bottom section, and keep any extra flex cables in the upper compartment separately, so that the case closes better without putting unnecessary stress on the battery itself. I also noticed that after one night of having the device and cables inside the case (zipped up), that the case did loosen up a little bit... so it is a little forgiving even though it is a hard case. I honestly don't think I could have found another low profile hard case that was any closer in dimensions for our Mophie Powerstation XL device, without having to go with a huge case, or something taller... so save yourself the trouble if you don't have a lot of time to research for the best case... this is as close to perfect as you can really get for the Mophie Powerstation XL & Powerstation Duo devices.
summary: Great case fitment for the Mophie Powerstation XL battery pack & cables! Very impressed with the quality!

reviewText:
Purchased from TRD-Trading GmbH through Amazon - both AAAAA+++++++++

Battery-

1st off I disagree with some of the other reviews that the battery life is simular to other Android phones. It's not. The battery life on the Note is 3 times better ! This is the 1st device that I have been able to leave the " Internet Hotspot " feature on all day and at the same time talking, pushing email, and sending receiving texts for 12 hours straight with 40% battery to spare. I cannot seem to run out the battery on this Note in a day no matter how much I use it !!

Display-

As I former iPhone 4s user I was a little worried about outdoor display readability. The iPhone 4s was great for outdoors so I was not willing to compromise up grading to the Note. No disappointment here. The funny thing about the Note's display is it seems to actually get brighter the longer it is exposed to direct sunlight. If you work out doors as I do this Note is perfect.

Radio reception/ call quality-

Excellent on both.

S-pen-

Smooth as silk. It's like writing with the perfect pen that you just cannot ever seem to find at the office supply store regardless how much $ you spend. ONE GRIPE THOUGH, IT IS WAY TO EASY TO ACCIDENTLY TOUCH THE NEXT PAGE/ SAVE BUTTON WHILE HANDWRITING A NOTE. SAMSUNG, THIS NEEDS TO BE DEACTIVATED WHILE WRITING!!!!!

Speed-

No hic ups, no lag, just smooth and fast app switching and loading.

Speaker-

This is the one area where it does not keep up with the iPhone 4s. The speaker is plenty adequate, but not as loud as it should be for a phone of this power and size.

Build-

Solid as a rock.

Size-

This is what had me on the fence for a little while. Takes a couple days to get used to it. Once you have you will not be happy with the smaller display device any longer. Now that I have been using the Note for a month I decided to pick up a iPhone and a Galaxy Nexus just to see what I used to be used to. No dice, I'm telling you once you get used to the display, larger keyboard layout, and performance of the Note there is no going back!!

Samsung Hit the ball out of the park with this one.

reviewText:
When I plugged it into my computer, the whole computer turned off. When it powered on, I received this message from the BIOS: "USB device over current status detected" and it shutdown after 15 seconds. I'm running a self-built computer with an over 900W power supply, and I only had 1 other USB device connected.

Out of curiosity, I tried it in another USB port (on the back) - same result. Also, the same result in my Toshiba laptop. I also tried it in a USB wall charger I have, and it produced an electric arc. Obviously, it doesn't work. I'm just glad it didn't damage any of my hardware.

See if you can find a better quality product - this one is junk.

This actually a pretty nice case. I didn't know what to expect when I ordered it but I have to say that it has exceeded most of my expections. The color matches the one that it showed of the web site and that doesn't always happen when you order online. I put this on my wife's phone and she really likes it.

It's a two piece case and when it's all put together, you feel like your phone is going to be protected in case of a drop. It has decent grip which is a biggie for me. I hate a case that's protective but yet it has little to no grip on the phone or just the opposite and the phone has the soft rubber on it and you can't get the phone in or out of a pocket without a fight.

The buttons are very easy to use in fact, she has turned on the phone several times just getting the phone out of her purse. It's not a real big deal but just letting people know. Overall, this is a very well made and protective case that is definitely worth getting.

I received this case for free in return for my unbiased review of the product.

My first thought upon picking this portable charger was that this thing is not too heavy. The weight and size is good and very fitting for what the device can do. I would say that it is not bulky and thus is rather fitting.

I have been using this device for over a month now and it is still going strong! It charges my phone like any other portable charger worth its salt - at a fast pace with the correct voltage and everything.

As for the cosmetics I do like their indicator system as I have a few other portable chargers that feature a lone LED light. I am not bothered too much by them, but this is quite the preferred system: This charger has three indicator lights that can either blink or light up completely according to the current battery charge level - and there are little depictions next to each LED that illustrates what each level corresponds to. Multiple indicators are my ideal way of reading portable chargers as one light ones can sometimes be relatively ambiguous.

The battery lasts and it charges well, what more could I ask for? Additionally the size and lights are all perfect for my needs so I have no complaints there. So in the end, I am glad I got to pick up this battery charger and I am thankful I got it at a discounted price no less.  I want to point out that I did get the reduced price as I had ordered it for evaluative purposes. However all of my findings are truthful and only based on what I _personally_ have experienced firsthand!
summary: The weight and size is good and very fitting for what the device can do

The quality of the wire/rubber/plastic is abysmal, but the mic is incredible. I'm amazed at the sound that this mic can record. It's very impressive. If they just made the cable with better materials (plastic is cheap, plastic around the mic is junk) and added volume up and down buttons I would pay a little more for it. There are no other cables that have this nice of a form factor. The look is really great.

To make this an A+ no brainer must buy they will have to:

1. Use better plastic and rubber
2. Enhance the quality of the mic/remote enclosure
3. Add volume functionality

Do this and the cable would be worth more and I would have no problem spending more on it.

If you are planning on using this with a phone in a pocket then I suggest you purchase the 6 foot cable (6 ft, 6') because the 4 foot is just a smidgen too short because of the coil.
summary: Incredible mic but falls short on quality of materials.

I have tested out a lot of different iPhone 6 cases and while I usually use something big and bulky that gives excellent drop protection I have been using slim cases a lot more.  This case is a unique three piece design, not including the screen protector, that has a majority of the case being a hard plastic shell with two softer plastic pieces that go on the top and bottom of the phone.

The fit of the case is quite nice, the buttons are easy to use and the ports and switch are all easy to access.  There is a small company logo on the back, which is not too intrusive, and there is a cutout for the Apple logo, something I'd rather not have but I know a lot of people want to show off the fact that they have an iPhone.

The case provides a nice amount of grip and feels good in the hand.  The only thing I really was not thrilled with was the top and bottom pieces never really feel totally secure.  More than once I felt the edge starting to come off when I was pulling the phone from my pocket as it is way too easy to remove the top and bottom pieces on the phone.

Overall this is a nice looking case but people that put their phone into a tight-fitting pocket might end up popping the top or bottom off inadvertently.

Sample provided for review.
summary: Nice Looking & Nice Feeling Case But The Top And Bottom Aren't That Secure

The solar charging didn't seem to charge it very quickly and certainly not back up to full.  The only way I got it fully charged was by plugging it in.  If you're looking for a waterproof charger, this isn't a bad option, but I can't say as a solar charger it works very well.  The carabiner it came with was a joke as it wasn't big enough for the charger and was very cheap so I just replaced it with a better one that fit and one that I didn't have to worry about it breaking.

My wife was looking for something to help her take pictures from her Samsung Galaxy S3.  She was tired of not having enough fingers to take decent pictures and often used other body parts like toes, knees, her nose....I'm sure a few people out there are nodding in agreement that they've done the same thing as her!  There are not many Bluetooth  remotes out there that are compatible with her older model phone.

I was surprised to come across this remote boasting that it would be compatiable with her phone.  I didn't hesitate at the opportunity to give this remote a try and see if it really would work.

This remote comes with a quick start user manual and an extra battery.  I would personally like a remote to have the ability to charge using a USB cable, but this remote comes with an extra battery and the type of battery it uses is a fairly common one.  Once we turned on the Bluetooth from the ol' S3, it immediately recognized the remote and we were in business.  Needless to say, the remote works just fine with the phone's camera.  There is a suggested app that is listed on the manual which allows one to use more features of the remote, such as the zoom in and out  This remote also worked on her iPad.

This is a reasonably priced remote that has done everything this listing has stated.  It's small enough to fit a pocket or can be attached to a keyring or lanyard with a small notch located at the top of the remote.  Since the wife is happy with how it works and is thankful for no more taking pictures with her nose from her devices, I give this remote 5 stars.  Now all she needs is a tripod and her picture/video taking adventures will be immensely better.

I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review, and that is what I am providing. I have NOT been paid for this review. I will never shy away from listing negatives about products just because I received a discount or it was free; usually, I choose products that I am interested in trying already, and check out the reviews ahead of time to ensure it's something I will probably like, so many of my reviews are positive as a result of careful selection upfront, not because my positive reviews have been "bought" in any way. If there are negatives I notice about a product, you better bet I will list them! In this case, I have nothing negative to say about this product and I give the QuikPic Bluetooth Remote Shutter my full recommendation!

This a review for the 2015 Model that I have tested in my car on the dashboard, windshield and air vent. This was by far the best combo Dashboard Windshield phone holder that I have ever tested. Below I list the PROS about this superb model.

1 - Suction - the suction is so very tight, ultra tight, in fact I have never seen a holder with this much suction.

2 - Phone Mount - Extra sturdy to keep my phone in place. It first clicks tightly onto my phone then there is a round adjustment on the back of this to keep the phone in place so there is no way that the phone will fall out!

3- Easy to insert and remove the phone -- just press the back button to remove the phone. To re-insert the phone just press the back button and then push in the side holders, this is so easy!

4 - Phone stand - I also tested this on my counter with my phone and it makes a great phone stand as well!

5 - This is a very well thought out product. I think it is the best quality mount have ever tried. I like it so much that I am using it in my car and it will hold my phone whenever I am in my car.

iKross 3in1 Dashboard Windshield Air Vent Holder was provided to me for testing and reviewing. Personally, I love this unit and I am using it in my car and very much enjoying it.

This I highly recommend to all, as I can tell you this that I love this!
summary: The best phone mount that I have ever used! Very sturdy and easy to use!

reviewText:
I know what you're thinking ... what is so special about this cable; it's just a cable, right? No it's not just a cable! This thing was made to last. You know those "tough book" laptops construction engineers or military personnel carry around? This is like that, but way better. Anker is always keeping its innovative thinking cap on with its products, stretching past what was thought to be impossible, and making awesome products. So, comparing this cable to other cables in the past, this is definitely the better choice. I have so many cheap cables lying around that are damaged, torn apart, or just cheap. But this cable is staying for a long time. It's staying because it was built with focus, ambition, and strength. It's staying because it was made to do more and be more. It was made for you and me. And it can only be bought here. And a slight bonus, the cable comes with a Velcro strap to hold the cable coiled if you're that kind of person.

I have also tested the 6 foot micro USB cable. It is just as good as the 3 foot cable, but it came with TWO velcro straps! Really like how long it is.

I was given this product from Anker for free to review, and I was not paid to write this review. If you're out on the market for a cable, start here.

reviewText:
Just received this case today to replace an Encased case/holster combo which had a few issues, one very important one being the charging port hole was too small to accommodate any of my 12+ micro USB charging cables, except for one (the OEM that came with the S7 fits exactly, which is likely the issue here, hole designed to fit only one size head).

From first impressions, I am giving it a solid 4 stars (I rarely give 5 because that would mean a perfect product which is far and few). The case seems very well made - all the cutouts are where they should be. The edges are firm and hard and the areas where I normally hold the phone are slightly rubberish to prevent the phone from easily slipping out of my hand, which is what I desire. The two volume and one power button are all very responsible.  The holster seems very solid as well, with the clip able to rotate 360 degrees.  The clip that holds the phone/case is along the long edge of the phone (as opposed to at the top) is a better design, IMO.  The plastic screen protector has a barely noticeable grid pattern to it and there seems to be bubbles where the plastic touches phone's scheen - unsure if these goes away over time. Looks ugly with the screen turned off (being black), but screen is on, it is not as noticeable.  Best of all the, the holes for both the headphone jack and micro USB power jack are big, all my micro USB power cables now fit !  The flaps that cover the two jacks are a nice touch for protection. The case fits very snug with the holster, and snaps in nicely.  Feel very nice.

A few improvements.
- allow users to easily remove the plastic screen protector.  For example, I already have a nice screen protector on mine - I may not want two layers
- move the holster clip that holds the phone/case a little lower. It is currently right below the bottom edge of the power button (a little too close for my liking, but not a biggie, yet)
- make the belt clip a very slightly wider to accommodate thicker belts (for example maybe make the gap 0.50 cm . For my thicker belt, the belt clip does not fully close all the way (almost there, just not perfect).

My first impression so far is that this is a very good value product - the next cases I will turn to first will be from SUPCASE.  Keep up the good work and do not become complacent - keep improving your products and keep prices reasonable.  No need to buy an Otter (and I had my share) - a SUPCASE would be just fine.

*** A big thanks to all the folks who answered my question - it made a difference in my purchase.
summary: Very glad I bought this case.

Can't beat the price for this case.  It fits perfectly with zero wiggle room. All the buttons and keys are easily accessible. The shape seems very well designed. All the edges of the button openings are rounded and smooth with the exception of a couple spots where there seems to be a rough edge where the shell halves meet.

Without any case, the phone is light and slippery in my hand.  After adding this case it gave the phone just enough weight and thickness to fit comfortably in my hand.  The feel of the 'rubberized' plastic is smooth but not slick, so it slides easily into my pocket.
As far as shear protection, this case will simply guard against scratches on the phone. There is no way this case would hold up if dropped.

Lots of reviews state that the case is nearly impossible to open once you have it on the phone.  I can confirm this. But following the instructions of an earlier review, if you slide your finger nail into the seam of the case along the left side, it will pop open the first set of clips.  Slowly run  your finger around the bottom of the case to the right side and then the whole thing will open up. But being careful is important if you wish to not crack it.
I opened my case about 15-20 times before one of the clips finally broke.  The case still works, but one side of it is loose now.

Final thought: Buy this if you plan on rarely opening it up, don't buy it if you plan on removing your phone from the case often.

The sound is tinny and doesn't seem loud enough even with the headset and phone both on max volume. I drive a truck for a living and don't really think I will be able to hear adequately with these in a working environment. Even if they were loud enough the sound is still tinny and low quality.

As soon as I received the shipping notification for my new iPhone 6 Plus, I ordered this case. I looked at what seemed like hundreds of cases before deciding on this one.
Pros:
- This case looks great! Just as you would expect, the case has a minimalist design that doesn't take away from the sleek look of the iPhone. It is by far the best looking iPhone 6 Plus case I've seen.
- It add very little bulk
- You can see the back of the phone, but it's all protected. (Cases with a cut-out for the apple logo really bug me).
- Appears to be made with high quality materials
- Comes with a lifetime warranty, and you can't beat that!
Cons:
- The "bumper" part of the case is a hard material. Personally, I would prefer a softer, more rubber-like bumper as I think it would a) provide more shock absorption and b) provide more of a grip on this slippery phone.
Overall:
I really love the look of this case, especially since the novelty of having a brand new phone is still going strong and the case really shows off the look of the phone. Right now, I am extremely careful with the phone having just paid full price for it. Eventually, however, I am going to have to face reality. I have two children under 4 years old that inevitably will get their sticky fingers on my phone. One day I will forget to place it on the high shelf and it will get tossed across the room like a baseball. Before that happens, I will likely need to look for a slightly more protective case.
I would highly recommend this case as long as your phone is not likely to be assaulted by slimy, yogurt-covered little fingers and flung through the air.

reviewText:
This Ultra battery pack is amazing. It charged my tablet and iPhone 4 & 5 up pretty well and fast.  I have also used this to charge my brother's Motorola G Phone, and it charged it up with still half of juice left. The leather feel to it on top is also very well made and feels great. Now, you can't carry this battery pack in your pocket because of its size, but that's alright since the number of charges to your phone or electric that it can charge is worth it. The four blue light is amazing especially when you use the turn on and off feature with a slide of your finger. To tell you the truth, this is my first battery pack that I actually have had with this automatic on/off touch feature to it, which to me is pretty cool and innovative. Also, another awesome feature to it is that when your electronic device has fully charged, the blue light will stop blinking and stay solid. This tells you that your device is fully charged and ready. When you get ready to charge this battery pack, since this is an powerful one, it is going to take about 8-10 hours to charge it, so the best thing is to charge it at night while you are sleeping, which okay with me.  When all four blue lights are solid, it will shut off after charging, so you don't have to worry about this device getting overheated. After using this amazing battery pack for almost a week with no problems whatsoever, I can definitely say that this Skiva Ultra Battery Pack is a must have. I will definitely recommend this Product to my family members and friends.

Note:"I was sent a sample in Exchange for My Honest Opinion/Feedback"
summary: A Very Powerful & Unique Ultra Battery Pack to Have!

I have to chuckle when I read all the moaning about how outdated and pitiful phones like this are. If you want pitiful you should have seen my first radio; two transistors, AM only, thin metal and brittle plastic. Expensive 9 volt battery that barely lasted an hour, and yet it was
MAGIC compared to the tiny crystal radio I'd had for years before that.
Now days it isn't enough that smartphones improve every few months; where is the holographic above-screen mini-orgies? Better yet full size holo-decks controlled by super phone! Teleportation anyone?
It was years before the transistor found a use in AM radios and even more years before the first IC was born (with 2,300 transistors). Now the engineers are capable of putting more than 100,000,000 transistors on the head of a pin! What a time to be alive!
As for the Motorola Bravo; I say "bravo Motorola". I'd had a big expensive phone for more than a year and was ready to replace it with whatever comes next but it occurred to me that even the outdated Bravo would do everything I want done and it does. Made out of very durable materials it should last years and it only costs the equivalent of my truly pitiful two transistor radio back in 1960!
Update: I guess I'm not a "power user" and I definately don't want a huge screen phone that screams GEEK everytime I make a call on it, but I've yet to find this little phone lacking in any way. Even the 2.21 OS is entirely adequate. And one final item that may not even be available anymore--user replaceable battery. Now if ATT was equally pleasant to deal with!

reviewText: This is the perfect travel charger. I find myself normally traveling and by the end of the trek to the hotel the cell phone is dead, the nook is dead, the headset is dead. I use this charger on the road to keep my devices going during the long ride to the airport and then the rest of the trip. By the time everything has been recharged I am using my chargers for my phone and other devices at night so how do I charge my battery pack for the next days journey? Well this New Trent Travelpak is the best idea since sliced bread. It plugs directly into the wall outlet. I don't have to worry about another charger or cable or anything. I plug it in, it shows me how it is charging and when it is charged I take it out the next day. I charge my phone, my friends phone traveling with me, my headset, the list goes on and on. Then I pop it out and charge this in a wall outlet at the airport and keep going and going. I could never do that with another battery that used the same charger as my phone since I never would have time to charge both. Perfect item!

I bought a 4-pack to give to my wife for Mothers Day.  (She is always losing her keys.)  One of the tiles in the pack did not work.  Amazon graciously sent a replacement 4-pack to me.  In the replacement 4-pack two of the tiles did not work, but all I needed was one.  So I swapped the one tile and returned a 4-pack that now contained three (3) non-working tiles.

Meanwhile I decided to rename one of my tiles.  I don't think there's a way to rename tiles.  A named tile appears "dead" in that the "e" key activation failed.  (You press the 'e' in the word "Tile" on a tile in order to activate.)  It could be that the (3) non-working tiles are simply ones that other customers had named and then returned.  Perhaps that's a security feature.

On the other hand, the three (3) tiles I activated last week have been working.  I wish I felt a little more comfortable about them holding out for a year, but only time will tell.  All the alternatives are worse.  So I'm giving this 4 stars in the hopes that the tiles will hold out for a year.

I have the Droid X by Motorola and I originally had the Motorola holster designed specifically for the DX, but it broke after 3 weeks of use. After reading the review left by Michael, I decided to go ahead and purchase this pouch. Finding a generic case/pouch was near impossible since the DX is a little bigger than most cell phones. I received the item yesterday and opened it right away. The first thing I did was slide my phone into the pouch and closed it to check for fit. My DX fit perfectly; if I shake the pouch, I do not feel the phone move at all; it's that snug! It is exactly what I wanted.

Two things I will note.
1. The stitching on my pouch is not white, it's black. So to me, it looks even better than the one pictured.
2. The little rectangular logo (REIKO)is not present on my pouch. It is actually impressed in the leather, making it much more visually appealing.

I would definitely recommend this to DX owners!!

UPDATE 10/12/2010:
The users that have reported that their Droid X will not fit in this case (or having to force their Droid X into the case) are definitely not reviewing the same case that I received. The pictures that are shown for product view are of my actual case as well as my actual Droid X. If you receive your case and it has a tag that indicates "iPhone" anywhere on the tag, DO NOT OPEN IT! Return it to Amazon and have them correct it. Also, do a visual inspection before opening. The Droid X and HTC Evo are large and will not fit most cell phone cases. Put your phone up to it and visually compare the size of the case to the size of your phone. If you have any doubt, you are better off just returning the case.
