This was hugely frustrating to install. There are no instructions other than a tiny line drawing on the box. I couldn't tell if the gold dots needed to be covered up, aligned in a special way, etc. Placement DOES matter, as I learned the hard way. I was impressed that I could get my case back on my phone after installation, but then it wouldn't work at first. Eventually, it worked, but is temperamental at times in terms of charging. Tech support doesn't answer. I didn't get help until the next day via email, and it was written in broken English, so I was confused . Meanwhile, my battery was almost gone and I got the charging system because my  charging port stopped working, so I was stuck. Luckily, everything works fine now and it's quite handy.

I knew that I needed a phone-specific receiver to attach to my phone's battery in order to charge it with a separately sold charging pad, but they should do a better job of explaining that you need to purchase 2 separate items. One is general (the Qi pad), one is specific (the receiver for my exact phone). I didn't realize that different receivers charge at different speeds (like everything else with computers, there's a number that indicates speed). I also didn't know I could mix and match brands between receivers and chargers. They definitely need to spell out exactly how to place the receiver on your phone battery and offer some troubleshooting info.
summary: Needs to come with installation and troubleshooting instructions

reviewText: This case is built well.  I've come to expect this quality from OtterBox. First off, the bottom of the silicon shell in the front of the case sometimes is slightly raised.  I don't think it can be helped as the design of the case doesn't really leave much room for more reinforcement.  This is a very minor thing that most people probably will not notice.  The second thing again is a part of the design that they probably can't fix.  This being that the opening around the TouchID sensor is open to allow for it's use.  This could allow dust particles to get between the screen the the screen protector.  The bottom line is that the OtterBox company is very easy to work with and they stand behind their products so for me that's worth the price  of admission.

Good case, fits snug.  Adds almost no weight to your phone. I doubt it would survive a drop in this case, but that's what the hard cases are for.  I just wanted something light and this fit the bill.
It died a week after i received it.

This wireless charger works. It get hot- very hot (so 1 less star).  I can see the red light when it's plugged into my USB port and when I put my phone on it there is a blue light that flashes when it's in the correct place and my iPhone with make that charging ding noise. The iPhone adapter has no instructions but it's easy to figure out. It plugs into my phone when the charger cable would go and folds to the back (doesn't need secured). I replaced my case over it and it'll charge right through my wallet case. Now I said it gets hot and it does however I pull it off about every 15 minutes and let my phone cool and then continue to charge. My phone was never "said too hot" like it has in the sun before. The base also gets hot. It cools after the phone is removed. It has no skid feet. All in all I do like this. It's small enough to travel with and doesn't take up much space. I would not leave my phone on it over night or for several hours either. This charges quickly so I make sure my phone is charged before bed and I'm good to go. I think it's a great price point and it works well- just be warned about the heat and it'll be fine.

Excellent quality. Easy to use.
I researched several models before purchasing this. I was close to buying the Motorola, but, upon further review, I decided this would be the best option. And, boy, was it ever!
I have to admit, when I decide I want to buy something, I research extensively. I think I went through several models and brands I've the course if a few days before deciding on this. To top it all off, the setup was so easy, I virtually was able to use it right out of the box.
The sound quality is high, and I've never had anyone complain about the quality of my voice from my end. Most people don't even know I'm in my car! Actually, only one person asked me if they were on a "speakerphone"with my window open. I think it's because I moved through an area that was very loud.
I highly recommend this product. It's high quality, easy to use/setup, and the price is really right.
Liked it soo much I bought more for spares when I need them...

I have just completed one month of owning of Samsung Galaxy Nexus and I have no doubt declaring I am very happy with this. This is the best smart phone on the market for the time being until iPhone 5 or Samsung Galaxy S3 releases. I had iPhone 4 for 2 months and I like many other people who could not be satisfied with beauty and fruit brand alone threw that 'dumb beauty' . For me that was more of a 'show off' rather than of practical use.

Apple itself in a recent patent suit directed against google termed this as the "most creditable competitor to iPhone'. Apple co founder which is not a apple employee anymore and hence free to speak truth freely declared iPhone easy to use but 'Android more feature rich'. He dismissed Siri totally saying he could not understand how come internet could be needed to make a call through Siri. Do I need to say more now? If yes then here is the detail review:

Like ->
(1) Bigger HD contour display-> Though you can distinguish between pixels while looking closely unlike iPhone's Retina display, Nexus's display is gorgeous. Colors are very vibrant and rich. Black is real black (because of Super AMOLED display technology) which creates the whole difference.
The Screen is large and with medium hands I can reach to the whole screen stretching the thumb or fingers. Sometimes I tend to use the other hand (luckily I have two hands and both are fully functional so can't complaint).

Because of bigger screen this phone is more useful or convenient for what Apple invented iPhone for ie Browsing web, playing games, watching videos. And because of this I tend to depend lesser on PC/laptop/tablet. With bigger screen, power and customization of Android OS this phone is closer to our old friend PC/laptop.

**I run the same HD video both on nexus and iPhone 4S and nexus one was better to watch.**

(2) Soul-> The soul of this device is ICS OS which is now equal to iOS in terms of user friendlessness but is better because it is much more customizable and hence you feel completely in control and power. This is different feeling than using dumb iOS. After using ICS I really struggled to use the iOS or same iOS based apps. ICS is lightning fast and smooth.
Face unlock, NFC, android beam and google wallet (not available on Verizon version) are very cool. Face unlock works perfectly.
Built-in Data usage monitor is very helpful for not letting you go above your data limit.
-> Mine is international unlocked version which within a week got automatically updated to 4.0.2 from 4.0.1.
This has Best notification, better customization for web browsing.

Ohhhhhhhh... did I tell you android has taken two steps which is miles ahead of time and going to change the things completely? (i) No Physical button-> The buttons are in fact part of OS itself and function well. Hence the buttons can now be context specific and smarter. They change their position depending on how you are holding the phone or what you are doing. While watching video they disappear completely giving you the whole screen for watching, and yes they will reappear on appropriate place when you need them. (ii) Same OS for all devices: Unlike Apple now same application can run on any device running on ICS. For apple the applications need to be written separately both for iPhone and iPad. That's why Apple has lesser applications on iPads. With new approach of ICS now people will just write once and run it anywhere hence number of apps is going to get multiplied faster on ICS.

(3) Eco System (Apps)-> Android eco system (or app market) is there on par with Apple eco system. In the same period I have installed much more applications ($150-$200 of worth in Apple world AND YES ALL FREE!!!!!!!) than I did on iPhone 4 (because most applications are free compared to Apple). I am more functional on Android than I was on iPhone 4. There is nothing which I want and its not there. And yes now google going to start monitoring of applications so less argument against Android apps.
(4) Form factor-> I like its form factor more than of iPhone's. Countered makes it more convenient to use and keep in the pocket. Now to me iPhone is just any another device and I look on iPhone with pity.
(5) Battery-> I need to charge it once a day with low to moderate usage which is what other iPhone 4S customers are also doing. And if you are going to use it like laptop you will need to charge it more (is not this same with your laptop?). Better part is unlike iPhone you can carry batteries and change it easily. No complaint here.
(6) Reception-> Decent.
(7) Call quality-> Nice.
(8) Volume/Speaker-> Low, could be helped with volume control plus application.
(9) More social-> Very well integrated with google.
(10). Build-> Except the battery cover everything else is of high quality. I don't care about plastic versus metal debate. iPhone even with metal and corning glass are equivalently fragile and people have been reporting iPhone being broken having dropped just from 12 feet or so. And with gorilla glass on both ends iPhone 4 is more fragile. Remember gorilla glass is just scratch resistant not damage resistant.
(11) Typing-> is a breeze and it seems to read you mind and hence make typing a different experience than on iPhone. And big screen helps every here again.

Unfortunately this phone decided to do have some deliberate suicidal traits perhaps to avoid wiping away other Samsung devices. So here are the things which could have been improved upon:
(1) Speaker-> Could have been better (Minor+ issue)
(2) Reception-> Though not much complaint, Could have been just a 'little' better (Very Minor issue).
(3) Camera-> Could have been better definitely.
(4) External Storage-> Either they should have allowed adding external storage or given the device with more alternated with respect to storage capacities. (Minor issue)
(5) Display-> Should not be able to distinguish pixels (Minor issue but this should be ultimate goal for the display)

Conclusion-> This is the best smart phone on the market for the time being if you can live with some minor issue with volume. And all issues reported so far with this device seem to be software issues and should get corrected with updates or third part applications.
summary: Near to Perfect Smart Phone, overall better than any nearest Rival

reviewText:
I really liked this case charger for my iphone. So much that I purchased 3 for the family. Mine stopped working after about 38 days. A email to YHhao was answered hours after I sent it , with a response that a new case was in the mail. No questions asked. They just wanted to resolve my problem. And they achieved this perfectly. You cant ask for any better customer service!
As for the case when it was working it was awesome. It uses your lightning cable instead of many other companies using micro USB. Why do I want micro usb when I have a house full of iphone cables and chargers ? It doubles the battery life of your phone and charges the external battery in about the same amount of time it takes to charge the internal battery. The case is a little slick to the touch but after using it a week it is ok.
The case fits the iphone perfectly with all buttons working good. The case surrounds the phone nicely and will give you great protection.
At $19.99 a great price for extra battery life and good case protection. We will see how my other 2 of these cases hold up.
Works well.  I use it as backup one.
One of the spring pins on one cable wasn't aligned right, and wouldn't charge. Other one was fine. Quality control issues, but you get what you don't pay for.
summary: Other one was fine. Quality control issues

reviewText:
Wonderful case and holster combo. The case is fitted perfectly for the Zerolemon 7500 mah Samsung S4 battery, and holds it in place. You need to pop out a rectangular region to let the expanded battery poke through the clamshell, but the rubber part covers it well.
The hard plastic/rubber locks around the plastic clamshell securely. Firm, quality construction.
My only gripe is I can't put it in the holster the other way, unless I holster it screen-facing-out. (I'm a klutz with bad luck, I don't want the screen exposed like that!)  On that note, not entirely certain what the other two notches are for, though all three notches serve the additional purpose of locking the two halves of the clamshell together in addition to the 6 or 7 snaps around the case.
Doesn't block the light sensor like some other holster cases I've used, which is a plus!
Curved and ribbed sides improve grip.

When I first removed this from the box, I wondered how something this small would securely hold a 10 inch tablet. It does it well. This little unit has a heavy feel, and the adjustable arm on the back clicks firmly into place. The possible viewing angles range between virtually straight up to almost flat on the table. One of my main uses for this is to hold the tablet in place to use as a digital picture frame. Since it is so well constructed, the small size of this stand becomes an advantage; for all intents and purposes it will be invisible and will not compete with the tablet for attention. The price is more than acceptable for a unit of this quality. I believe you would be hard pressed to find a better stand at any price.
summary: Outstanding quality in a unit that outperforms its size...

I had a similar case by a different company for my previous phone so I tried this one at the cheaper price, thinking they were all made by the same Chinese manufacturer anyway but with a different brand label. I was wrong about that because the design and quality for this case was poor.

It looks great, but the wallet case door feels flimsy and bendy, and difficult to open. The card slot design is too large so the cards are loose inside and will slide around, making noise when you move your phone around. I didn't think this was a big deal but it did get annoying.

The biggest point of getting the case is for protection and the wallet. The wallet portion sucked, as described above, and the protection failed as well. On a single drop of this phone, falling screen side down, the front bezel protection did not do anything to protect the phone and my screen was shattered. This was the first time I've ever had a screen crack or shatter for any phone I've had for years so I was definitely shocked. I immediately switched the case to my previous one, which has had several drops with no issue so I felt it was safer. Got the screen fixed and used the other case with no problem. I wish I could've taken a picture but did not think about writing a review at that time. Buyer beware of this case, not all of these designs are the same, nor the quality.
summary: Poor wallet and protection design, screen was shattered!

Great little set of lenses for the iPhone 6s plus. They really add something extra to the pictures I've been taking.  You get two pieces in the package, but there are 3 different lenses total.  The wide angle lens screws off to give way to the macro lens. I like that the material around the lens is a light metal instead of plastic.  The fisheye lens does not leave black edges nor does it look cheesy like a drop of water with a picture in it.  The only thing I will say about these is that you have to have the lens centered on the camera.  Some cases may not suit the lens and you may have to take off the case while shooting.  Failure to position the lens correctly may cause some blurriness in your photos.  If your photos come out blurry, adjust your lens until you get a clear picture.  Each lens comes with a lens cover.  I wish these came with a small microfiber bag to store the lenses though.
I did NOT get these at a discount, I paid full price.

*** UPDATE***  A few weeks later and it's still a good product!  Took to the beach and it did a great job.
summary: macro and fish eye are the ones I use most.

I was impressed by the build quality on this charger. Had a nice heft to it.  A lot of the chargers available feel cheap and are made of plastic. The plug for the usb cord had a snug fit.  The type C charge port was equally well fitting. Both signs of good build quality.  Cheaply made chargers usually don't have very good tolerances in the charge ports and the inserted cords can sometimes lose contact due to slipping. This unit charged my phone from 60% to full in about 1 hr. Nice charger overall. Would recommend for anyone that needs a quick charger for their phone or tablet.

note: I received a discount on this product for my review, however that discount did not affect my views on the product

I purchased this this phone after my old one randomly quit on me. I was with Boost Mobile before, but decided to switch carriers because long story short, Boost is terrible and I was sick of them. Anyway, I've only been using the Samsung Galaxy Avant for a couple of days, but so far I really like it.

Pros:

-Phone Runs Smoothly

-Build Quality (Looks and feels nice)

-16GB of Memory

-Good Coverage (Where I am, at least)

Cons:

-Battery Life (3-4hrs with heavy usage on full charge)

-Display (It's has a decent size screen, but colors look a bit washed out/dull and the is resolution bit low)

Overall, this phone is decent for the price. I'm satisfied with it at the moment and I will definitely update if I experience any issues. Also, I'm liking T-Mobile so far. I'm on the $80 unlimited everything plan (I'm a heavy data user) and everything is working great. I honestly don't know what their exact data speeds are, but when I'm web browsing everything loads quickly and YouTube videos play without buffering on normal quality.
